intro: Scorzonera eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically covered in a dense layer of white to grayish hairs. Scorzonera eriocarpa is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
